Email UsRaymond Lawrence COLBY was born on 28 JUN 1896 in Woodstock, McHenry County, Illinois. He appeared in the census on 11 JUN 1900 in McHenry, McHenry County, Illinois. (living at home with father and mother.) He appeared in the census in 1920 in McHenry, McHenry County, Illinois. He appeared in the census in 1930 in McHenry, McHenry County, Illinois. He died in JUN 1982 at Woodstock, McHenry County, Illinois. He has Ancestral File Number 58HS-G0. He had Social Security Number 356-12-3109. Parents: George Wallace COLBY and Emily Diane SHAFLER.

Spouse: Esther Grace SATTEM. Raymond Lawrence COLBY and Esther Grace SATTEM were married on 17 SEP 1916 in McHenry, McHenry County, Illinois. Children were: Walter P. COLBY, Chester L. COLBY, Shirley COLBY, Esther COLBY, Beryl COLBY, Raymond Lawrence COLBY Jr..

Raymond Lawrence COLBY Jr. was born on 2 NOV 1936 in McHenry, McHenry County, Illinois. He died on 22 OCT 2006 at Yakima, Yakima County, Washington.

YAKIMA, WA

Raymond Lawrence Colby Jr., 69, Yakima, died Sunday, October 22, 2006 at Yakima Valley Memorial Hospital.

Raymond Lawrence Colby Jr. was born November 2, 1936 to Raymond L. Colby and Esther Sattem Colby at McHenry, Illinois where he lived until he was five years old. The family moved to Woodstock, Illinois where Ray attended elementary and secondary schools. While in high school, he became a student of music and learned to play the piano. After graduation in 1945, he moved to Norfolk, Nebraska where he learned the trade of watchmaking and repair. At the age of 27, he was invited to an evangelistic meeting at the Norfolk Community Bible Church where he committed his life to his Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. Later, he committed his life to preaching and teaching the Word of God, which he did faithfully.

On August 7, 1965 he married Beverly Pearson from Crystal Lake, Illinois. Soon after, they moved to Dallas, Texas where he studied at Dallas Bible College and earned his diploma. During this time, three sons were born to them (Kevin, Laurin, and Nathan) who he loved deeply. He was committed to his family and spent time with them camping, playing games, and being involved in their lives.

In 1971, Ray and Beverly became Village Missionaries at the Nile Community Church in Nile, Washington where they ministered for 4 1/2 years. He poured himself into serving the community through the church.

In November of 1975 Ray accepted the position of Chaplain at Living Care Retirement Community (formerly known as Living Care Center). He ministered there for nearly 31 years before he was taken home to be with the Lord. His heart went out to the people he served and he loved this ministry. He was willing to help those in need and had a passion for reaching others for Christ.

Ray became a master of the piano and enjoyed sharing his music through concerts at health care facilities and through his professional recordings. Recently, he enjoyed the opportunities of serving on short-term missions in Australia, Greece, and Washington D.C. He gave himself wholeheartedly to everything he did. He was loved by those who knew him and will be greatly missed.

He is survived by his wife, Beverly Colby of Yakima; three sons, Kevin Ray Colby and his wife, Jill of Yakima, Laurin Paul Colby and his wife, Corrine of Florissant, CO and Nathan Jay Colby and his wife, Susan of Yakima; eight grandchildren, Allyson, Noelle, Tyler, Benjamin, Kirsten, Michael, Noah and Luke; two brothers, Chester Colby and his wife, Marguerite of Brooksville, FL, George Colby and his wife, Carol of LaValle, WI and a sister, Esther Seibol of Woodstock, IL and a brother-in-law, Paul Zigenbein, sister-in-law, Lillian Colby.

He was preceded in death by a brother, Walter Colby, a sister, Beryl Woodworth, a sister, Shirley Zigenbein, and two brothers-in-law, George Seibol and John Woodworth.

Visitation will be from 4 to 8 p.m. Wednesday at the Keith & Keith Ninth Avenue Chapel. A graveside service will be held at 11:00 a.m. Thursday, October 26, 2006 at West Hills Memorial Park. A memorial service will follow at 2:00 p.m. at the Ahtanum Pioneer Church, 8500 Ahtanum Rd. Yakima.

In memory of Raymond Colby, a donation may be sent to Cannon Beach Christian Conference Center, PO Box 398, Cannon Beach, OR 97110-0398.

Keith and Keith is in charge of funeral arrangements. To celebrate the life of Ray Colby visit our website at www.mem.com.

Rebecca Faye COLBY was born on 24 JUL 1956 in Long Beach, Los Angeles County, California. She died on 24 NOV 1990 at Salt Lake City, Salt Lake County, Utah. Her obituary appeared in the Deseret News, Salt Lake City, Salt Lake County, Utah on 25 NOV 1990.

Deseret News

Sunday, Nov. 25, 1990

REBECCA FAYE COLBY RODEN

Rebecca Faye Colby Roden died November 24, 1990 in Salt Lake City, Utah.

Born July 24, 1956 in Long Beach, California to Dan Collins Colby and LaVon Jean Reid.

Married Ronald Roden March 12, 1983 in Elko, Nevada.

She was loved by all and will be missed greatly.

Survived by husband; mother, Salt Lake City; father, Calif.; brother, Lee Colby, Salt Lake City; stepchildren, Ron, Jackie, and Don, Salt Lake City; two step-grandchildren; three nieces, Kathleen, Rosemary, and Kelly.

Private family services will be held. Funeral Directors Wasatch Lawn Mortuary.

Reginald Carroll COLBY was born on 3 APR 1919 in Wiscasset, Lincoln County, Maine. He appeared in the census in 1920 in Bath, Sagadahoc County, Maine. (living at home with father and mother.) He died on 2 FEB 2004 at Nevada, Story County, Iowa.

Reginald C. Colby

February 05, 2004

Reginald C. Colby, 84 of Bearden, Ark., died of pneumonia after a long illness on Monday, Feb. 2, at Story County Medical Center, Nevada. Memorial services will at 11 a.m. Friday, Feb. 6, at Story County Medical Center Chapel, with the Rev. David Burling officiating. There also will be a memorial service at 11 a.m. Tuesday, Feb. 10, at First Assembly of God Church in Bearden, Ark., with the Rev. Charles Taylor and the Rev. Wayne McGuire officiating. Burial of the cremains will be in Moss Hill Cemetery in Bearden, Ark.

Reginald Carroll Colby was born on April 3, 1919, in Wiscasset, Maine, to Lennie and Ethel "Nanny" (Davis) Colby. He married Lurlie Summers on Oct. 25, 1974, in Memphis, Tenn. He served in the U.S. Army during World War II. Reginald retired in 1974 as a superintendent of large construction. He attended the Assembly of God Church in Bearden, Ark., until his illness rendered him homebound. Reginald was an avid hunter, fisherman and a master woodworker.

Reginald is survived by his wife, Lurlie, of Bearden, Ark.; two step daughters, Gale (Ernie) Herrera of Altoona and Reyna (Wade) Evans of Mitchellville; two sons, Brandon Colby of Orland, Calif., and Randall Colby of Calif.; two daughters, Rebecca Callan of Concord, Calif., and Stephanie (Ron) Campbell of Orland, Calif.; one brother, Le Roy (Lillian) Colby of Wiscasset, Maine; one sister, Dorothy Palus of Bath, Maine; six grandsons; one step grandson; and one step great grandson.

He was preceded in death by his parents; one sister, Louise Pinkham; and one brother, Perley Colby.

In lieu of flowers, a memorial fund has been established for the Story County Medical Center Foundation, 630 Sixth Street, Nevada, IA 50201.

Chet Ryan Mortuary is in charge of arrangements.
